stanza.line: Your love and pity doth th impressionfill
Which vulgar scandal stamped upon my brow
For what care I who calls me well orill
So you oer green my bad my good allow
You are my all the world and I muststrive
To know my shames and praises from your tongue
None else to me nor I to nonealive
That my steeled sense or changes right or wrong
In so profound abysm I throw all care
Of others voices that my addersense
To critic and to flatterer stopped are
Mark how with my neglect I dodispense
You are so strongly in my purposebred
That all the world besides methinks aredead
